message.content:
Cirsium vulgare is a flowering plant species commonly known as the Bull Thistle. 
It has a tall and upright stem that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height. 
The stem is covered in a thick coat of spiny leaves. 
The flowers are a deep shade of purple-pink in color and are arranged in a globe-shaped head. 
The leaves are deeply lobed and have a rough, hairy texture. 
Cirsium vulgare is commonly found in meadows, pastures and along roadsides. 
It is often considered a weed but is also used in traditional medicine for its therapeutic properties.
